Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2016 12:00AM Weneke6 wrote: I had breast pain that came and went for about two weeks. Started right before my period and went full into the next cycle and then the other boob decided to play. Went tests. Nothing was found. I am 42 and my mother entered menopause at 44. I have been having weird periods and a flair up of heartburn that I have never had before. One turned out to be peri-menapusel symptoms and a strained Cooper ligament. I also have a 5 year old who I tend to lift and and move my body in weird ways for. I am left handed and well..... So try and relax and please listen to these lovely ladies. Find doctors you trust and trust them.
Posts.Title: Breast Pain Gracemarie Weneke6

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2017 09:47PM - edited Jan 4, 2017 09:51PM by Weneke6 I just finished my 15 treatments Tuesday. I was fine until that last week. Then I broke out and certain areas were sore and swollen. And itchy. I got folliculitis. I used hydrocortisone which made it worse. The whole time all i used was vaseline lotion 3 times day. The last week a used Eucerine and that was just sticky and I didn't really see a difference. Once I went back to the just the vaseline, the itchy stopped and it has been clearing up. I am red, but not blistered and the pain is from inside not outside and more of an ache then actual pain. I took alive one night and sleep on my side with my daughters heart shaped pillow under my arm and against my breast. I used dove deodorant and body wash everyday. I wore a tank top for bed and sports bra daily. No issues there. I walked 3 miles a day and dark a lot of water. One thing I figured out is if you keep going after treatment, you are fine. it's when you stop you get tired fast. Just glad to be done. Good luck and God bless.
Posts.Title: Starting Rads in January 2017 ElizabethAM Caligirl55

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2017 01:17PM Weneke6 wrote: Even if it is in your head, your feeling it. Rest, put the lotion on and I found that letting a fan run over the breast cooled it down and helped the pain.

Posts.Content: Weneke6 wrote: Hi everyone again. So I have fibrocystic breasts. Cysts on both breast diagnosed from a mammogram and U/s last May. My breast get very sensitive from ovulation all the way until my period ends. My period has been weird for a couple of months. This one seems to lighter and dragging out. It start on the 16th. I am 42. Anyways, the last two weeks I have had the normal pain. But this one seems to have settled into only my left breast. All over spots. No real focal. My shoulder had ached as have sometimes taking a deep breath. The pain is not debilitating and the itch not persistent, more like a tickle every now and then. The pain more of a discomfort and ache. It might be slightly bigger then the other one but not noticeably. I heard everyone has bigger boob, I never noticed. No difference in texture, swollen, redness, lumps, discharge... I mentioned this to a friend she told me it sounded like BC. So we googled and came up with IBC. I called my doctor and they can't see me until Dec 28th. I am freaking out and already imagining my daughter without a mother. Not to mention every time I try and watch tv the cancer commercials are on these days. Is that a sign??? Any thoughts, ? Thanks Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2016 10:54PM Weneke6 wrote: Thank you all. I had the mammo and ultrasound. NOTHING showed. I had three different docs do full breast exams. My Gyno who has seen IBC and otters breast cancer cases said that it is most likely peri-menopauses symptoms and a injury to Cooper ligament. I have now not been having any more real pain on that side that is not on the other. I brought three people to all the exams so they could remind and hear and see so I didn't not miss anything that was said and done. Just because I know when you get hyper worried you tend to focus and not pay attention to facts. Thank and I am sorry for taking time away from hose who need it more.

Posts.Content:
Weneke6 wrote: Can anyone tell me what this means? It was just posted to the patient portal and doc won't be in until tomorrow.  On the magnification views there are indeterminate grouped calcifications in the right upper outer breast. These microcalcifications have a mild heterogenous morphology but no significant pleomorphism. The largest is 0.7 cm in the posterior nipple 9:00. The other slightly smaller group of over an 0.6 cm length probably about 10:00

Posts.Content: Oct 17, 2016 07:20PM Weneke6 wrote: I won't lie I was scared. BUT the nurses were very nice. I had two nurses who talked to me and held my hand. There was no real pain, a little burn feeling when the first shot. I was sitting in a chair, with a pillow behind draped over the mammogram machine. There were two doctors. I found it actually less scary with them telling me what they were doing even though I couldn't see or feel it. Took the unknown out. Mine only lasted 30 minutes.
